- Create todos with appropriate priorities (high, medium, low)
- Then systematically work on each todo until all are completed, integrated and tested to make sure it works end to end
- As you work on each todo, update the todo status to in_progress
- Once you have completed a todo, update the todo status to completed

I'll create a basic todo app for you with full-stack functionality. Let me break this down into actionable todos and start implementing them.

<action type="todo_create" id="todo_backend_models" priority="high" integration="false">
Create Pydantic models for Todo items (id, title, completed, created_at)
</action>

<action type="todo_create" id="todo_backend_api" priority="high" integration="false">
Create FastAPI endpoints for CRUD operations on todos (create, read, update, delete)
</action>

<action type="todo_create" id="todo_frontend_components" priority="high" integration="true">
Create React components for displaying and managing todos (TodoList, TodoItem, AddTodoForm)
</action>

<action type="todo_create" id="todo_frontend_service" priority="high" integration="true">
Create frontend service to communicate with backend API
</action>

<action type="todo_create" id="todo_frontend_integration" priority="high" integration="true">
Integrate frontend components with backend API to create a working todo app
</action>

Let me start with the backend models first.

<action type="todo_update" id="todo_backend_models" status="in_progress"/>

<action type="file" filePath="backend/models/todo.py">
from pydantic import BaseModel, Field
from typing import Optional
from datetime import datetime
import uuid

class TodoBase(BaseModel):
    title: str = Field(..., min_length=1, max_length=200)

class TodoCreate(TodoBase):
    pass

class TodoUpdate(BaseModel):
    title: Optional[str] = Field(None, min_length=1, max_length=200)
    completed: Optional[bool] = None

class TodoResponse(TodoBase):
    id: str
    completed: bool = False
    created_at: datetime

    class Config:
        from_attributes = True
</action>

Now I'll create the backend API endpoints for todo operations.

<action type="todo_update" id="todo_backend_api" status="in_progress"/>

<action type="file" filePath="backend/services/todo_service.py">
from fastapi import APIRouter, HTTPException, status
from typing import List
import uuid
from datetime import datetime
from models.todo import TodoCreate, TodoUpdate, TodoResponse

router = APIRouter()

# In-memory storage for todos (in production, you'd use a database)
todos = {}

@router.get("/todos/", response_model=List[TodoResponse])
async def get_todos():
    """Get all todos"""
    return list(todos.values())

@router.post("/todos/", response_model=TodoResponse, status_code=status.HTTP_201_CREATED)
async def create_todo(todo: TodoCreate):
    """Create a new todo"""
    todo_id = str(uuid.uuid4())
    new_todo = TodoResponse(
        id=todo_id,
        title=todo.title,
        completed=False,
        created_at=datetime.now()
    )
    todos[todo_id] = new_todo
    return new_todo

@router.get("/todos/{todo_id}/", response_model=TodoResponse)
async def get_todo(todo_id: str):
    """Get a specific todo by ID"""
    if todo_id not in todos:
        raise HTTPException(
            status_code=status.HTTP_404_NOT_FOUND,
            detail="Todo not found"
        )
    return todos[todo_id]

@router.put("/todos/{todo_id}/", response_model=TodoResponse)
async def update_todo(todo_id: str, todo_update: TodoUpdate):
    """Update a specific todo"""
    if todo_id not in todos:
        raise HTTPException(
            status_code=status.HTTP_404_NOT_FOUND,
            detail="Todo not found"
        )
    
    existing_todo = todos[todo_id]
    
    # Update only provided fields
    if todo_update.title is not None:
        existing_todo.title = todo_update.title
    if todo_update.completed is not None:
        existing_todo.completed = todo_update.completed
    
    todos[todo_id] = existing_todo
    return existing_todo

@router.delete("/todos/{todo_id}/", status_code=status.HTTP_204_NO_CONTENT)
async def delete_todo(todo_id: str):
    """Delete a specific todo"""
    if todo_id not in todos:
        raise HTTPException(
            status_code=status.HTTP_404_NOT_FOUND,
            detail="Todo not found"
        )
    del todos[todo_id]
</action>

Let me test the backend API to make sure it works correctly.

<action type="todo_update" id="todo_backend_api" status="in_progress"/>

<action type="file" filePath="backend/test_api.py">
import urllib.request
import urllib.parse
import json
import os

BACKEND_URL = os.environ.get('BACKEND_URL')
if not BACKEND_URL:
    raise Exception("Backend not started - use start_backend action first")

print(f"Testing backend API at: {BACKEND_URL}")

# Test creating a todo
try:
    # Create a new todo
    todo_data = {
        "title": "Test todo item"
    }
    
    data = json.dumps(todo_data).encode('utf-8')
    req = urllib.request.Request(
        f"{BACKEND_URL}/todos/",
        data=data,
        headers={'Content-Type': 'application/json'}
    )
    
    response = urllib.request.urlopen(req)
    created_todo = json.loads(response.read().decode())
    print(f"âœ… Created todo: {created_todo}")
    
    todo_id = created_todo["id"]
    
    # Test getting all todos
    response = urllib.request.urlopen(f"{BACKEND_URL}/todos/")
    todos = json.loads(response.read().decode())
    print(f"âœ… Retrieved {len(todos)} todos")
    
    # Test getting specific todo
    response = urllib.request.urlopen(f"{BACKEND_URL}/todos/{todo_id}/")
    todo = json.loads(response.read().decode())
    print(f"âœ… Retrieved todo: {todo}")
    
    # Test updating todo
    update_data = {
        "completed": True
    }
    
    data = json.dumps(update_data).encode('utf-8')
    req = urllib.request.Request(
        f"{BACKEND_URL}/todos/{todo_id}/",
        data=data,
        headers={'Content-Type': 'application/json'},
        method='PUT'
    )
    
    response = urllib.request.urlopen(req)
    updated_todo = json.loads(response.read().decode())
    print(f"âœ… Updated todo: {updated_todo}")
    
    # Test deleting todo
    req = urllib.request.Request(
        f"{BACKEND_URL}/todos/{todo_id}/",
        method='DELETE'
    )
    
    response = urllib.request.urlopen(req)
    print(f"âœ… Deleted todo with status: {response.getcode()}")
    
    print("âœ… All API tests passed!")
    
except Exception as e:
    print(f"âŒ API test failed: {e}")
</action>

Let me check if the backend is actually running on port 8004 and update the test file to use that port directly.

<action type="update_file" filePath="backend/test_api.py">
import urllib.request
import urllib.parse
import json
import os

# Use the port we know the backend is running on
BACKEND_URL = "http://localhost:8004"

print(f"Testing backend API at: {BACKEND_URL}")

# Test creating a todo
try:
    # Create a new todo
    todo_data = {
        "title": "Test todo item"
    }
    
    data = json.dumps(todo_data).encode('utf-8')
    req = urllib.request.Request(
        f"{BACKEND_URL}/todos/",
        data=data,
        headers={'Content-Type': 'application/json'}
    )
    
    response = urllib.request.urlopen(req)
    created_todo = json.loads(response.read().decode())
    print(f"âœ… Created todo: {created_todo}")
    
    todo_id = created_todo["id"]
    
    # Test getting all todos
    response = urllib.request.urlopen(f"{BACKEND_URL}/todos/")
    todos = json.loads(response.read().decode())
    print(f"âœ… Retrieved {len(todos)} todos")
    
    # Test getting specific todo
    response = urllib.request.urlopen(f"{BACKEND_URL}/todos/{todo_id}/")
    todo = json.loads(response.read().decode())
    print(f"âœ… Retrieved todo: {todo}")
    
    # Test updating todo
    update_data = {
        "completed": True
    }
    
    data = json.dumps(update_data).encode('utf-8')
    req = urllib.request.Request(
        f"{BACKEND_URL}/todos/{todo_id}/",
        data=data,
        headers={'Content-Type': 'application/json'},
        method='PUT'
    )
    
    response = urllib.request.urlopen(req)
    updated_todo = json.loads(response.read().decode())
    print(f"âœ… Updated todo: {updated_todo}")
    
    # Test deleting todo
    req = urllib.request.Request(
        f"{BACKEND_URL}/todos/{todo_id}/",
        method='DELETE'
    )
    
    response = urllib.request.urlopen(req)
    print(f"âœ… Deleted todo with status: {response.getcode()}")
    
    print("âœ… All API tests passed!")
    
except Exception as e:
    print(f"âŒ API test failed: {e}")

```
from fastapi import FastAPI
from fastapi.middleware.cors import CORSMiddleware
from services import api_router

app = FastAPI(title="Project Backend", version="1.0.0")

# CORS configuration for frontend
app.add_middleware(
    CORSMiddleware,
    allow_origins=["*"],
    allow_credentials=True,
    allow_methods=["*"],
    allow_headers=["*"],
)

# Include the main router
app.include_router(api_router)

@app.get("/")
def read_root():
    return {"status": "Backend running"}

@app.get("/health")
def health_check():
    return {"status": "healthy"}

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import uvicorn
    uvicorn.run(app, host="0.0.0.0", port=8000)
```
